definition: Puyi, personal name of the last Qing emperor (reigned as child 1909-1911), the subject of Bertolucci's biopic The Last Emperor
extensive/pervading
surname Pu
apparatus/rites/appearance/present/ceremony

sentences.english: The ashes of Puyi, the Last Emperor, lie in the Babaoshan Cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 末代皇帝溥儀的骨灰被葬在八寶山。

sentences.english: A fairly strange picture of the ex-emperor Puyi with some Italians.
sentences.chinese: 一張較怪的溥儀照片，與一些意大利人在一起。

sentences.english: Tagore is pictured with China's last emperor Pu Yi in 1924.
sentences.chinese: 有1924年泰戈爾和末代皇帝溥儀的合影。

sentences.english: He followed him north and then the puppet regime collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 他追隨溥儀到北方直到傀儡政府垮臺。

sentences.english: The face of a polar bear pelt looms before the uniforms of China's last emperor, Puyi.
sentences.chinese: 北極熊熊皮的背後隱約可見中國末代皇帝溥儀的皇服。

sentences.english: The last Imperial family was the Qing Imperial family Aisin Gioro and the last Chinese Emperor was Puyi.
sentences.chinese: 最後的皇室是清皇試冬愛新覺羅莢冬溥儀是末代天子。

sentences.english: He followed him north and then the puppet regime collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 他跟溥儀一起到了東北，可是傀儡政權卻又崩潰了。

definition: Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Zhang Zuolin (c. 1873-1928), warlord of Manchuria 1916-1928
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Aisin Gioro, family name of the Manchu emperors of the Qing dynasty
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705
coup d'état
to act as regent
military clique/junta/warlord
Imperial Household Department (in Qing dynasty)
destruction
Zhang Xueliang (1901-2001) son of Fengtian clique warlord, then senior general for the Nationalists and subsequently for the People's Liberation Army
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
